channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI

item.title: Report E-2024030065
item.description:
Report E-2024030065

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: BURTON
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0830 when loading onto trailer a small amount of material was noticed around the seal. Absorbent was immediately put down to stop the material. They then call for our internal response team to address the leak. The team arrived to address it at around 1100. They found that the seal was damaged and needed to be fixed. The team the dawned the appropriate PPE and began fixing the seal. The seal and clean up was completed by 1800 with only about half cup being released.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was discovered to be wet when unloading a trailer and brought to QA. DescribePack: One bottle had a loose cap and the inner seal was broken allowing contents to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a plastic lined tub to contain the leak.

item.title: Report X-2024021374
item.description:
Report X-2024021374

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DAMAGED METAL BUCKET WAS FOUND DURING UNLOAD PUT IN A HAZMAT TOTE AND BROUGHT OVER FOR INSPECTION. UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND TO BE A DAMAGED HAZMAT AND THE HAZMAT PROCESS WAS STARTED. DescribePack: DENT IN THE LID OF THE BUCKET WAS THE CAUSE FOR THE LEAK. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: BUCKET WAS TURNED RIGHT SIDE UP.

item.title: Report X-2024021281
item.description:
Report X-2024021281

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: LIVONIA
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: WITH PROPER PPE AND DECISION TREE, RESPONDER CALLED TO LINE 2 CLERK STATION. UPON INSPECTION FOUND CORROSIVE 8 BATTERIES WET FILLED WITH ACID PACKAGE BROUGHT IN BY THE ONCAR HAZMAT SUPERVISOR. THE PACAGE CONTAINED A 12 VOLT LEAD ACID BATTERY LEAKING A SMALL AMOUNT OF BATTERY ACID FROM THE TOP CLOSURE. TOOK BACK TO DMP AREA FOR PROCESSING.

Report X-2024021148

  • City: SAGINAW

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was being unloaded and the package handler noticed the box was wet. QA was called and took the package to the hazmat processing area. DescribePack: One of the bottles had a loose cap spilling about a cup of the liquid onto the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed inside a hazmat tote and taken to the hazmat processing area.

item.title: Report E-2024020515
item.description:
Report E-2024020515

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 7ft-by-6ft area of the trailer floor and 2ft-by-5ft area of the asphalt lot and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to a minor crack in the top corner of the 250-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel transferred the remaining product to a new poly tote. Hepaco personnel stated that prior to their arrival terminal personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and that additional granular absorbents were used by Hepaco personnel and then Hepaco gathered the spent material and placed into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums along with the shredded damaged poly tote. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024020072
item.description:
Report I-2024020072

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-19
  • City: Niles
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: N&M TRANSFER
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While off-loading at the terminal, one Ieaking tote was discovered inside of the trailer. An estimated half a gallon of free product was released. The trailer was isolated pending cleanup. Environmental Restoration LLC(ERLLC) was dispatched to perform the cleanup. ERLLC arrived and inspected the Ieaking tote. ERLLC discovered a small hole in the top of the tote. ERLLC deplyoed absorbent material as needed. ERLLC transferred the product into a new tote. The waste and damaged tote were placed into a yard bag and left on the trailer for disposal.
